POOF.content: apostrophic pledge (gage apostrophique et sa citation): could apostrophe (uttered on edge of life, i.e. death) ever offer a pledge w/out substitution?
POOF.linkedContent: apostrophic pledge (gage apostrophique et sa citation): could apostrophe (uttered on edge of life, i.e. death) ever offer a pledge w/out substitution?

A.content: whenever someone speaks of someone else, cites or praises him or her, one must hear: this is the story of my life [re: Diderot accusing Seneca, pardoning Seneca, asking for pardon himself]
A.linkedContent: whenever someone speaks of someone else, cites or praises him or her, one must hear: this is the story of my life [re: Diderot accusing Seneca, pardoning Seneca, asking for pardon himself]

SEC.content: Husserl’s “green is or” still example of agrammaticality: a mark can be cited [is legible?], written, function cut off from “original” meaning > can engender infinitely new contexts
SEC.linkedContent: Husserl’s “green is or” still example of agrammaticality: a mark can be cited [is legible?], written, function cut off from “original” meaning > can engender infinitely new contexts

SEC.content: cela ne suppose pas que la marque vaut hors contexte, mais au contraire qu’il n’y a que des contextes sans aucun centre d’ancrage absolu
SEC.linkedContent: cela ne suppose pas que la marque vaut hors contexte, mais au contraire qu’il n’y a que des contextes sans aucun centre d’ancrage absolu

SEC.content: insufficiency of speech act theory > parasitism and citationality not considered ordinary: “non-serious,” “non-ordinary,” sea change, etiolation
SEC.linkedContent: insufficiency of speech act theory > parasitism and citationality not considered ordinary: “non-serious,” “non-ordinary,” sea change, etiolation

SEC.content: Austin excludes determined modification of a general citationality, general iterability [cf. GLAS, general fetishism] w/out which no “successful” performative?
SEC.linkedContent: Austin excludes determined modification of a general citationality, general iterability [cf. GLAS, general fetishism] w/out which no “successful” performative?

SEC.content: citational doubling splits (scinder), dissocier d’avec elle-même the pure singularity of the event, as positive possibility (not failure)
SEC.linkedContent: citational doubling splits (scinder), dissocier d’avec elle-même the pure singularity of the event, as positive possibility (not failure)

PAS.content: yes, yes: force of affirmative repetition, unique call of the to-come as the will to repeat itself, affirmation that cites itself, joyous EROS, immeasurable unhappiness, irreducible contamination, affirmation risks citation, le oui qui fait dans la langue un trou aussi étrange que viens, il approuve, affirme, contresigne tout ce “qui est arrivé”
PAS.linkedContent: yes, yes: force of affirmative repetition, unique call of the to-come as the will to repeat itself, affirmation that cites itself, joyous EROS, immeasurable unhappiness, irreducible contamination, affirmation risks citation, le oui qui fait dans la langue un trou aussi étrange que viens, il approuve, affirme, contresigne tout ce “qui est arrivé”

PAS.content: Blanchot’s récit as new thought of citation acc. EROS, repetition of yes that begins by doubling itself, récit unscathed, unique force of a viens that never reproduces itself: viens —sauf
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s récit as new thought of citation acc. EROS, repetition of yes that begins by doubling itself, récit unscathed, unique force of a viens that never reproduces itself: viens —sauf

PAS.content: unjustifiable and impossible the cutting out (le découpage) to which Derrida is submitting Blanchot’s texts > he does it to slowly approach his unheard of signature, plunge back dans son eau
PAS.linkedContent: unjustifiable and impossible the cutting out (le découpage) to which Derrida is submitting Blanchot’s texts > he does it to slowly approach his unheard of signature, plunge back dans son eau

PAS.content: risk of interruption is run, programmed in the night, by the récit
PAS.linkedContent: risk of interruption is run, programmed in the night, by the récit

PAS.content: from where the right to interrupt? unjustifiable violence of interruption, nothing more servile, indiscreet, unspeakable than generalizing, appropriating the unique, breaking the seal of an absolute singularity [re: citing from Friendship, on single friendship btwn Bataille & Blanchot]
PAS.linkedContent: from where the right to interrupt? unjustifiable violence of interruption, nothing more servile, indiscreet, unspeakable than generalizing, appropriating the unique, breaking the seal of an absolute singularity [re: citing from Friendship, on single friendship btwn Bataille & Blanchot]

PAS.content: the first sentence, no matter how inaugural it may seem, always recites itself in advance
PAS.linkedContent: the first sentence, no matter how inaugural it may seem, always recites itself in advance

PAS.content: [récit] btwn 2 affirmations, legendary suspense, in which the undecided lets itself be lured (se laisse attirer)
PAS.linkedContent: [récit] btwn 2 affirmations, legendary suspense, in which the undecided lets itself be lured (se laisse attirer)

PAS.content: Viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), Blanchot’s récits as exemplary citations, their unique power is that the unscathed possibility of unique (le sauf) remains in reserve from which “I would emerge” to say, to one of them,“Viens”
PAS.linkedContent: Viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), Blanchot’s récits as exemplary citations, their unique power is that the unscathed possibility of unique (le sauf) remains in reserve from which “I would emerge” to say, to one of them,“Viens”

PAS.content: “terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept
PAS.linkedContent: “terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept

PAS.content: [on not citing his sources] the worst méconaissance of Blanchot’s text, hand over incommensurable in it to the market, the hierarchy, the dominant effects tied to name & law, but [other voice] there’s always benefits of mastery for sovereign renunciation, it’s gonna happen, il faut en rendre compte, the gift itself never forgets itself, nor the forgetting
PAS.linkedContent: [on not citing his sources] the worst méconaissance of Blanchot’s text, hand over incommensurable in it to the market, the hierarchy, the dominant effects tied to name & law, but [other voice] there’s always benefits of mastery for sovereign renunciation, it’s gonna happen, il faut en rendre compte, the gift itself never forgets itself, nor the forgetting

PAS.content: Derrida always interrupts Blanchot’s citations very arbitrarily, he is interested, like Blanchot, in logic of parts and partage
PAS.linkedContent: Derrida always interrupts Blanchot’s citations very arbitrarily, he is interested, like Blanchot, in logic of parts and partage

PAS.content: even if we could cite everything (read everything), the whole would still be lacking
PAS.linkedContent: even if we could cite everything (read everything), the whole would still be lacking

OTO.content: btwn title & book to come, exergue situates place from which life will be recited: yes, yes, amen, amen, I sign, I am in debt to “high noon” [instant of signature, no place]
OTO.linkedContent: btwn title & book to come, exergue situates place from which life will be recited: yes, yes, amen, amen, I sign, I am in debt to “high noon” [instant of signature, no place]

D.content: tout “commence” donc par la citation, dans les faux plis (creases) d’un certain voile, of a certain mirror-like screen
D.linkedContent: tout “commence” donc par la citation, dans les faux plis (creases) d’un certain voile, of a certain mirror-like screen

D.content: cited text, prior past still to come
D.linkedContent: cited text, prior past still to come

LI.content: can a signature be cited? what are the consequences?
LI.linkedContent: can a signature be cited? what are the consequences?

LI.content: signature is on the edge of the text (neither inside nor outside)
LI.linkedContent: signature is on the edge of the text (neither inside nor outside)

LI.content: Derrida will cite Sarl at length to enrich iterative corpus which is the object of discussion
LI.linkedContent: Derrida will cite Sarl at length to enrich iterative corpus which is the object of discussion

LI.content: is it still a citation if you underline parts of the quote?
LI.linkedContent: is it still a citation if you underline parts of the quote?

LI.content: [quoted from SEC] doesn’t a performative have to be identifiable as a “citation?”
LI.linkedContent: [quoted from SEC] doesn’t a performative have to be identifiable as a “citation?”

LI.content: not conflating parasitism & citationality but identifying possibility they have in common [i.e. iterability] (use of or that signifies neither equivalence, dissociation, nor opposition)
LI.linkedContent: not conflating parasitism & citationality but identifying possibility they have in common [i.e. iterability] (use of or that signifies neither equivalence, dissociation, nor opposition)

LI.content: parasitism susceptible to parasitism of citation; citation can always be parasited by parasite
LI.linkedContent: parasitism susceptible to parasitism of citation; citation can always be parasited by parasite

LI.content: citationality not confused w/ iterability but traced back to it
LI.linkedContent: citationality not confused w/ iterability but traced back to it

ATM.content: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage
ATM.linkedContent: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage

ATM.content: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge (bordure): seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language
ATM.linkedContent: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge (bordure): seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language

ATM.content: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre
ATM.linkedContent: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre

LG.content: no cause for concern [contamination of law w/ counter law] if one could rigorously distinguish citation from non-citation
LG.linkedContent: no cause for concern [contamination of law w/ counter law] if one could rigorously distinguish citation from non-citation

LG.content: [re: Blanchot’s La folie du jour] récit in récit > non-inclusive, so remote from dialectic that this structure inscribes dialectic in ellipsis of récit
LG.linkedContent: [re: Blanchot’s La folie du jour] récit in récit > non-inclusive, so remote from dialectic that this structure inscribes dialectic in ellipsis of récit
